page.title: 20COMMUNITY COUNCIL
page.content: Lismore's{Community Council}has{12 members{elected}by{all}the islanders. It meets once in{three months.}All meetings are open to the{public. An islander's{main concern}is with {ferries, piers}and{freight charges. The present Community Council has seen the building of a{new non-tidal pier at{Achnacroish,}with boats that run from Oban oftener in the summer and at more convenient times in winter. At Point there is a{new pedestrian slip which avoids a long walk over a slippery beach. There are{new shelters at{Point}and at{Port Appin,}and a {better slip}there too. The Community Council has in 1985{won a Church of Scotland{prize}of{Â£1000 for a{map}of Lismore's{Christian {Heritage,}_ and a thousand copies of the map itself, which they have given to the Church.
